head.note: This manuscript record does not have a summary list of contents. For composite manuscripts, the list of contents can be found under each individual part.

listRelation.desc: This composite manuscript consists of 6 distinct parts:

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

head.note: This manuscript contains: A collection of Hymns (ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ) and Canticles (ܣܘ̈ܓܝܬܐ), one of which is ascribed toJacob of Batnae(fol. 39 a), whilst the rest are either anonymous or assigned toEphraim. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 12 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A collection of Hymns (ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ) and Canticles (ܣܘ̈ܓܝܬܐ), one of which is ascribed toJacob of Batnae(fol. 39 a), whilst the rest are either anonymous or assigned toEphraim.
msItem.rubric: ܥܡ ܣ̇ܘܝܥܐ ܘܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ ܡܪܐ ܕܟܠ. ܟܬ݁ܒܝܢܢ ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܡ̈ܫܚܠܦܐ ܕܟܠܓܢܣ.

msItem.title: The Dead
msItem.note: One of these, beginning onfol. 39a, is ascribed toJacob of Batnae

msItem.title: Lent
msItem.quote: ܗܘܼ ܓܝܪ ܫܘܪܝܗ ܒܫܘܚܕܢܐ ܗܘ ܕܕܝ̇ܢܐ: ܕܫ̇ܚܕ ܘܟܢ ܢܣ̇ܒ ܢܗܘܐ ܫܠ̣ܝܛܐ. ܐܝܟܢ ܡ̣ܨܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܢܕܘܢ ܒܟܐܢܘܬܐ. ܕܝ̇ܕܥ ܕܪܝܫ̣ܐ ܗܘ̣ܐ ܒܟܣܦܐ: ܘܣܝܡܐ ܗܝ ܒܪܥܝܢܗ. ܕܐܟܡܐ ܕܝܗ̣ܒ ܢ̇ܣܒ. ܠܐ ܗܘܐ ܒܟܐܢܘܬܐ ܐܠܐ ܟܡܐ ܕܡ̇ܫܟܚ
msItem.note: On the margin of fol. 55 a , a reader has written a response.See additions.

msItem.title: The Miracles of our Lord
msItem.rubric: ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܥܠ ܬܕܡܪ̈ܬܐ ܕܣܥ̣ܪ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܒܙܒܢܐ ܕܡܕܒܪܢܘܬܗ ܕܒܒܣܪ܀ ܕܡ̇ܬܐܡܪܝܢ ܒܚܕܒ̈ܫܒܐ ܕܨܘܡܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܐܪܒܥܝܢ

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 1/4 in. by 6 1/2, consisting of 96 leaves (Add. 14,506, foll. 1—96), a few of which are slightly stained and torn, especially foll. 1, 27, and 96. The quires, 9 in number, are signed with letters. There are from 24 to 29 lines in each page. The last quire of this manuscript is palimpsest (see Add. 14506 foll. 85-96, lower text ).

collation.p: The quires, 9 in number, are signed with letters.

item.p: A few of the leaves are slightly stained and torn, especiallyfoll. 1, 27, and 96. The last quire, foll. 85-96, is palimpsest.

layout.p: There are from 24 to 29 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a good, regular hand of the xith cent. The name of the scribe seems to have been,ܖܒܗܝ(?).
The manuscript was corrected by oneBar-saumā of Mar'ash.See additions.

additions.note: N.B., items below may have been listed out of folio order in Wright's catalogue.

item.p: On the margin of fol. 68 a there is a note, written partly with red, partly with black ink, the first word of which is indistinct.

p.quote: ܖܒܗܝ (sic) ܟܬܘܒܐ ܟܬܒ ܗܠܝܢ. ܀ ܗܠܝܢ ܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܣܘܪ̈ܓܕܐ ܟܬܒܬܗ (ܟܬܝܒܬܗ) ܕܟܬܘܒܐ ܩܕܡܝܐ.

item.p: The manuscript was corrected by oneBar-saumā of Mar'ash, as appears from two marginal notes; the one on fol. 52 b,
The other note regardingBar-saumā of Mar'ashis found on fol. 76 a

p.quote: ܗܠܝܢ ܟܪܬ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܡܪܥܫܝܐ ܕܚܕܬ ܠܟܬܒ̈ܐ ܟܠܗܘܢ ܨܠܘ ܥܠ܏ܘ.

item.p: Some of the marginal corrections have an Arabic word appended; e. g. foll. 42 b
Some of the marginal corrections have an Arabic word appended; e. g. foll. 69 a.
A reader has written the words that follow in response to the quoted passage onfol. 55a

p.quote: ܚܙܘ ܦܛܪܝܪ̈ܟܐ ܕܙܒܢܢ ܕܬܩܠܘ ܒܝܢܬܗܘܢ ܐܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ ܐܠܦܝܢ ܕܝܢܪ̈ܐ ܠܫܘ̈ܠܛܢܐ ܚܢ̈ܦܐ ܘܝ ܚܣܕܐ ܪܫܝܥܐ (?). ܏ܗ ܐܬܐܢܣܝܘܣ ܘܓܪܓܘܪܝܘܣ ܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ ܘܚܡܫܡܐܐ ܘܚܡܬܥܣܪ (sic),

item.p: The last quire of this manuscript, foll. 85-96, is palimpsest

layout.p: The manuscript was written in two columns.

head.note: This manuscript contains: A collection of Hymns,ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 4 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: A collection of Hymns,ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ
msItem.rubric: ܒܫܡܗ ܕܡܪܢ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܫܝܚܐ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܕܢܟܬܘܒ ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܕܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܘܕܥܢ̈ܝܕܐ. ܕܡܬܐܡܪܢ (sic) ܒܫܗܪ̈ܐ
msItem.note: The special headings are as follows.

msItem.title: The holy Martyrs, including hymns on the Doctors and Fathers, among which are some onSeverus of Antioch.
The Dead, including one onJulian Sābā

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 in. by 6 1/8, consisting of 14 leaves, the last of which is much stained and torn (Add. 14,506, foll. 97—110). The first of the two quires is imperfect, leaves being wanting after foll. 97, 98 and 99. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 22 to 31 lines. This manuscript is palimpsest throughout (see Add. 14506 foll. 97-110, lower text ).

item.p: 14 leaves, the last of which is much stained and torn. The first of the two quires is imperfect, leaves being wanting afterfoll. 97, 98 and 99. This manuscript is palimpsest throughout.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 22 to 31 lines.

handNote.desc: This manuscript, which is palimpsest throughout, is written in a rather irregular hand of the xith cent. The scribe isJohn bar Mārūthā, a Tagritan, from the city ofDolūk(ܕܠܝܟorܕܠܘܟ)

item.label: Colophon
item.p: Onfol. 97 athere is a note by the scribe,John bar Mārūthā, a Tagritan, from the city ofDolūk(ܕܠܝܟorܕܠܘܟ; seeAssemani, Bibl. Orient., t. ii., Dissert, de Monophys., art. ix., Dolucha), residing atEdessa.

p.quote: ܐܢܐ ܝܘܚܢܢ ܒܪ ܡܪܘܬܐ ܬܓܪܝܬܢܝܐ. ܡܢ ܕܠܝܟ ܏ܡܕܝ ܕܥܡ̇ܪ ܐܢ̣ܐ ܒܒܝܬ ܝܚܝܕ̈ܝܐ ܕܛܘܼܪܐ ܩܕܝܫܐ ܕܐܘܪܗ̇ܝ ܡܕܝܢܬܐ ܡܒܪܟܬܐ ܕܣܪܛ݁ܬ ܐܝܟ ܚܝܠܝ ܟܘܪܣܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܕܣܗ̈ܕܐ ܘܕܥܢܝ̈ܕܐ. ܟܠ ܕܩ̇ܪܐ ܢܨ̇ܠܐ ܘܠܐ ܢܥܕܘܠ ܘܫܠܡ ܫܘܒܚܐ ܠܐܒܐ ܏ܘܫ.

physDesc.p: Vellum leaves, about 9 in. by 6 1/8. These two quires are palimpsest (see Add. 14506 foll. 97-110, upper text ). The older writing of this manuscript, but little of which is now legible (see in particular foll. 105 b and 106 b) is in two columns.

collation.p: As above mentioned, these two quires are palimpsest.

item.p: As above mentioned, these two quires are palimpsest.

handNote.desc: The older writing is in a good hand of the ixth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of a collection of hymns chiefly for the Nativity and the Epiphany. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 1 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of a collection of hymns chiefly for the Nativity and the Epiphany

physDesc.p: Eight vellum leaves, about 9 1/4 in. by 6 1/2, all slightly stained and soiled. They once formed the eleventh quire (ܝܐ) of a manuscript, the two centre leaves being missing. Each page is divided into two columns, of from 29 to 33 lines. The writing is good and regular, of the ixth cent.

collation.p: These leaves once formed the eleventh quire (ܝܐ) of a manuscript

item.p: Eight vellum leaves, all slightly stained and soiled. The two centre leaves are missing.

layout.p: Each page is divided into two columns, of from 29 to 33 lines.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the ixth cent.

head.note: This manuscript contains: Part of a large collection of hymns, canticles, etc. (ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ, ܣܘ̈ܓܝܬܐ, ܩ̈ܠܐ,ܒܥ̈ܘܬܐ,ܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܚܫܐ, andܩ̈ܢܘܢܐ), for the circle of the whole year. In total, including sub-sections, this manuscript contains 35 items.

listRelation.desc: This unit is a part of a composite manuscript:

msItem.title: Part of a large collection of hymns, canticles, etc. (ܡܕܪ̈ܫܐ, ܣܘ̈ܓܝܬܐ, ܩ̈ܠܐ,ܒܥ̈ܘܬܐ,ܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܚܫܐ, andܩ̈ܢܘܢܐ), for the circle of the whole year
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܦܢܩܝܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܕܟܪܘܟܝܐ ܕܫܢ̇ܬܐ. ܒܟܠܗܘܢ ܛܟ̈ܣܐܥ̈ܕܬܢܝܐ. ܒܩ̈ܠܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܝܥܩܘܒ. ܘܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ. ܘܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܒܣ̈ܡܐ. ܘܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܚܫܐ. ܘܩ̈ܢܘܢܐ. ܘܡ̈ܕܪܫܐ ܕܩܕܝܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܐܦܪܝܡ. ܘܒܣ̈ܘܓܝܬܐ. ܘܒܟܠܗ ܚܘܕܪܐ ܕܥ̈ܐܕܐ ܩܕܝܫ̈ܐ ..ܘ:ܘ.: ــ .ܘ:ܘ . ܫܘܒܚܐ ܠܐܠܗܐ ܐܒܐ. ܕܥܠ ܚܝܠܗ ܫܪܝܢܢ. ܘܒܥܘܕܪܢܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܐܠܗܝܐ ܥܕܪ ܠܢ. ܘܫܡܠܝܢܢ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ. ܘ . ܘ:ܘ . ܘ . ܐܝܟ ܐܠܦ̣ܐ ܠܠܡܐܢܐ ܡܢ ܩܛܝܪܐ ܕܓ̈ܠܠܐ̣. ܗܟܢܐ ܕܝܢ̣ ܘܣܘܪܓܕܐ ܐܚܪܝܐ ܠܟܬܘܒܐ ..

msItem.title: Hymns,ܡܥܢ̈ܝܬܐfor the Great Week
msItem.finalRubric: ܫܠܡ ܠܡܟܬܒ ܩ̈ܠܐ ܘܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ ܘܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܒܣ̈ܡܐ ܕܟܠܗ ܟܪܘܟܝܐ ܕܫܢܬܐ ܘܒ̈ܬܐ ܕܚܫܐ ܘܒ̈ܥܘܬܐ ܘܡܥ̈ܢܝܬܐ ܕܟܠܗ̇ ܫܒܬܐ ܪܒܬܐ.

msItem.title: Hymns and Canticles for the whole year
msItem.rubric: ܬܘܒ ܕܝܢ ܡܫܪܝܢܢ ܣܘ̈ܓܝܬܐ̣. ܕܟܠܗ ܟܪܘܟܝܐ ܕܫܢ̇ܬܐ
msItem.quote: ܕܥܠ ܣܘܒܪܗ ܕܙܟܪܝܐ: ܟܕ ܕܪܫ̇ ܥܡ ܡܠܐܟܐ

msItem.title: For the Friday of the Crucifixion
On the Cherub and the Thief
Hymns for the Invention of the Cross

physDesc.p: Vellum, about 9 3/8 in. by 6 5/8, consisting of 117 leaves (Add. 14,506, foll. 119—235). The quires, 12 in number, are signed with letters, commencing with ܟܙThere are from 25 to 29 linesin each page. This manuscript is written in a good, regular hand of the ixth or xth cent.

collation.p: The quires, 12 in number, are signed with letters, commencing withܟܙ

layout.p: There are from 25 to 29 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: This manuscript is written in a good, regular hand of the ixth or xth cent.

decoNote.p: There are coloured ornaments and borders onfoll. 168 b,234 b, and235 a.
There are coloured ornaments and borders onfoll. 168 b,234 b, and235 a.

item.label: Colophon
item.p: On fol. 235 a there is a note, stating that this manuscript was written by a monk namedJohn, at the expense of a person whose name has been erased.

p.quote: ܐܬܚ̇ܦܛ ܘܣ̣ܡ ܣܝܡܬܐ ܗܕܐ ܪܘܚܢܝܬܐ: ܐܝܟ ܕܠܝܘܬܪܢܐ ܕܢܦܫܗ ܘܕܟܠܗܘܢ ܪ̈ܚܡܝ ܝܘܠܦܢܐ܇ ܘܠܐܝܩܪܐ ܕܥܕܬܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ [ܡܪܝ ܐܚܘܕܡܗ] ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܗܟܝܠ ܕܒܪܚܡܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܩ̇ܪܐ ܒܗ ܘܡܬܒܣܡ̣. ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠܘܗܝ ܡܦܝܣ ܐܢܐ ܡܛܠܡܪܢ ܏ܘܫ. ܟܬܒ̣ ܕܝܢ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ̣. ܝܘܚܢܢ ܗ̇ܘ ܕܒܫܡܐ ܟܝܬ ܕܝܪܝܐ. ܐܠܐ ܡܦܝܣ ܐܢܐ ܠܟܘܢ ܐܘ ܐܚ̈ܝ܆ ܡܛܠ ܚܘܒܗ ܕܡܪܢ: ܕܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܒܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܦܓ݁ܥ: ܒܚܕ ܡܢ ܙ̈ܢܝܢ܆ ܢܨܠܐ ܥܠ ܡܚܝܠܘܬܝ. ܏ܘܫ. ܬܘܒ ܕܝܢ ܟܠ ܡ̇ܢ ܕܡܡܪܚ ܐܘ ܦܩ̇ܕ ܐܘ ܣ̇ܥܪ ܐܘ ܦܣ̇ܥ ܘܥ̇ܛܐ ܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ ܗܢܐ̣. ܢܗܘܐ ܡܚܪܡܐ ܐܦ ܢܘܟܪܝܐ ܡܢ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܡܢ ܥܕܬܗ. ܘܢܐܡܪ ܟܠܗ ܥܡܐ ܐܡܝܢ.. ܚܘܣ ܩܪܘܝܐ.. ܥܠ ܢܦܫܟ. ܘܠܐ ܬܣܥܐ ܥܠ ܡܠܬܐ ܕܐܠܗܐ.ܘ:ܘ.

item.p:
On fol. 235 the name of
Achudemes ܡܪܝ ܐܚܘܕܡܗ
has been substituted for the originally extant name.
At the foot of the page a later hand has added words identifyingthe convent of S. Mary Deipara.

p.quote: ܐܘ ܡܫܢܐ ܠܗ ܠܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܡܢ ܗܕܐ ܕܝܪܐ

item.p:
The short notes on fol. 235 b have been almost completely effaced, with the exception of one, which states that the manuscript belonged at one time to
Achudemes, the son ofHabīb ܕܡܪܝ ܐܚܘܕܡܗ ܒܪ ܚܒܝܒ

p.quote: ܀ ܐܝܬܘܗܝ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܐܚܘܕܡܗ ܒܪ ܚܒܝܒ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesiastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized East Syriac Script

revisionDesc.change: CHANGED: added or corrected folio extent values
ADDED: added decoNote elements for decorations
ADDED: supplied and corrected Syriaca.org URIs for authors
Added generic msItem title(s) based on ancestor title
Changed: Files moved to srophe-app-data/data/manuscripts/tei repository.
